250 corporate mergers are listed by the ACCC; however only a small proportion involved ICT companies.
280 corporate mergers are listed by the ACCC; however only a small proportion involved ICT companies.

Since, but not including, 2010, the ACCC has carried out 388 informal merger clearances, public competition assessments or merger authorisations. A very small percentage of these involved telecommunications or ICT companies.

Since, but not including, 2010, the ACCC has completed 341 informal merger clearances, public competition assessments and merger authorisations. A very small percentage of these involved telecommunications or ICT companies.
Since 2010-11, the ACCC has completed 1,942 informal merger clearances and public competition assessments. A very small percentage of these involved telecommunications or ICT companies.
Since 2010-11, the ACCC has completed 1,942 informal merger clearances and public competition assessments. A very small percentage of these involved telecommunications or ICT companies.

In the period 1 July 2010 to 31 December 2018, the ACCC considered 2,695 matters under section 50 of the Competition and Consumer Act 2010 (Act). Of these, 2179 were assessed as not requiring a public review (pre-assessed), and 516 underwent a public or confidential review. A very small percentage of the matters considered by the ACCC under s.50 of the Act involved telecommunications or ICT companies.

In the period 1 July 2010 to 30 June 2019, the ACCC considered 3,026 matters under section 50 of the Competition and Consumer Act 2010 (Act). Of these, 2,484 were assessed as not requiring a public review (pre-assessed), and 542 underwent a public or confidential review. A very small percentage of the matters considered by the ACCC under s.50 of the Act involved telecommunications or ICT companies.

No obstante y aunque no se defina el término fusión en la legislación ecuatoguineana, el Organismo Regulador podría intervenir en base a lo que le autoriza la Ley de Telecomunicaciones (vigilar la competencia) y utilizando referencias internacionales sobre como la fusión potencial de dos empresas puede afectar a la competencia.

En general es importante conocer que la deficiencia reglamentaria la suple el Regulador utilizando referencias reconocidas internacionalmente.

From Apr 2010 to Mar 2014, the former Telecommunications Authority and OFCA as known today has considered 7 cases under section 7P of the Telecommunications Ordinance, which regulates M&A activities involving a carrier licensee.

From April 2010 to December 2016, the Communications Authority had considered 11 cases under section 7P of the Telecommunications Ordinance, which regulates M&A activities involving a carrier licensee.   From December 2015 to March 2016, the Communications Authority had considered 2 cases under the Merger Rule of the Competition Ordinance.

From April 2010 to November 2015, the Communications Authority had considered 11 cases under section 7P of the Telecommunications Ordinance, which regulates M&A activities involving a carrier licensee. From December 2015 to April 2017, the Communications Authority had considered 3 cases under the Merger Rule of the Competition Ordinance.

From April 2010 to March 2012, before the establishment of the Communications Authority, the Telecommunications Authority had considered 2 cases under section 7P of the Telecommunications Ordinance, which regulates M&A activities involving a carrier licensee.  From April 2012 to November 2015, the Communications Authority had considered 9 cases under the same provision concerned.  From December 2015 to December 2017, the Communications Authority had considered 5 cases under the Merger Rule of the Competition Ordinance.

From April 2010 to March 2012, before the establishment of the Communications Authority, the Telecommunications Authority had considered 2 cases under section 7P of the Telecommunications Ordinance, which regulates M&A activities involving a carrier licensee.  From April 2012 to November 2015, the Communications Authority had considered 9 cases under the same provision concerned.  From December 2015 to December 2018, the Communications Authority had considered 7 cases under the Merger Rule of the Competition Ordinance.

From 1 January 2010 to 13 December 2015, before the Competition Ordinance came into operation, the Telecommunications Authority / Communications Authority had considered 11 cases under section 7P of the Telecommunications Ordinance, which regulated M&A activities involving a carrier licensee.  From 14 December 2015 to 31 December 2019, the Communications Authority had considered 8 cases under the Merger Rule of the Competition Ordinance.

Since 2014, the Competition Authority (now the Competition and Consumer Protection Commission) has examined 4 mergers affecting the electronic communications sector:

Southbank/N-Vision (broadcasting, specifically broadcasting of audiovisual content)- cleared at Phase I on 15 May 2015

Discovery/Setanta (broadcasting, specifically broadcasting of audiovisual content) - cleared at Phase I on 12 March 2015

CETP/Expereo (indirect provision of telecoms infrastructure through network of contracting parties) - cleared at Phase I on 14 August 2014

Sony/Step Topco (CSC Media) (supply of TV channels to operators) - cleared at Phase I on 28 July 2014

The Competition and Consumer Protection Commission is also in the process of conducting a Phase I review of the Liberty Global/TV3 transaction (TV and media sector) which was notified in July 2015.

Since 2014, the Competition Authority (now the Competition and Consumer Protection Commission) has examined the following mergers affecting the electronic communications sector: 

1. Southbank/N-Vision (broadcasting, specifically broadcasting of audiovisual content)- cleared at Phase I on 15 May 2015 

2. Discovery/Setanta (broadcasting, specifically broadcasting of audiovisual content) - cleared at Phase I on 12 March 2015 

3. CETP/Expereo (indirect provision of telecoms infrastructure through network of contracting parties) - cleared at Phase I on 14 August 2014 

4. Sony/Step Topco (CSC Media) (supply of TV channels to operators) - cleared at Phase I on 28 July 2014 

5. Liberty Global/TV3 transaction (TV and media sector) -  cleared at Phase I on 4 August 2015

6. Acquisition of Setanta Sports Asia Limited by Discovery Networks Asia-Pacific PTE. Limited (TV and media sector) -  cleared in 9 March 2015

7. Acquisition of UTV Limited by ITV Broadcasting Limited (TV broadcaster and operator) - cleared at Phase I 16 December 2015

8. Acquisition of Setanta Sports Ireland Channel Limited and certain assets and the business of Setanta Sports Hibernia S.à.r.l.by Eircom Limited (ECN/ECS provider/TV content) -  cleared at Phase I 8 January 2016

9. Acquisition by News Corporation, through its wholly owned subsidiary News Corp UK & Ireland Limited, of sole control of Wireless Group plc (Radio broadcasting and information services)  -  currently at Phase I.

En 2018, el IFT aprobó la adquisición de la infraestructura de fibra oscura propiedad de Pegaso PCS, S.A. de C.V. (Pegaso) por Even Telecom, S.A. de C.V. (Even) y Neutral Networks, S. de R.L. de C.V. (Neutral), también en 2018 se aprobó la adquisición de la infraestructura de fibra óptica propiedad de Sixsigma Networks México, S.A. de C.V. (Kio Networks), por ATC Mexhold, L.L.C. (Torre americana).

En marzo del 2019, el IFT aprobó la concentración por la que The Walt Disney Company (Disney) adquiere activos de Twenty-First Century Fox, Inc. (Fox), sujeta al cumplimiento de condiciones que previenen riesgos a la competencia. - En abril de 2019 el Pleno del Instituto autorizó en México la operación internacional consistente a la compra de la empresa ARRIS International, Plc., por parte de CommScope Holding Company, Inc. En abril de 2019 el Pleno del Instituto autorizó en México la operación internacional consistente a la compra Finisar Corporation por parte de II-VI Incorporated. - En noviembre de 2019, el Pleno del Instituto autorizó la compra por parte de American Tower de 250 torres de telecomunicaciones propiedad de Movistar localizadas en diversas entidades federativas de la República Mexicana. En noviembre de 2019, el Pleno del Instituto autorizó la adquisición por parte de Live Nation Entertainment, Inc., del 51% del capital social de OCESA Entretenimiento, S.A. de C.V.; del cual, un 40% de dicho capital era propiedad de Grupo Televisa S.A.B. de C.V. y el restante 11% de Corporación Interamericana de Entretenimiento, S.A.B. de C.V. (CIE). En diciembre de 2019, el Pleno del Instituto autorizó la compra, por parte de Equinix, Inc., de tres de los seis centros de datos propiedad de Axtel S.A.B. de C.V. a través de los cuales prestará el servicio de alojamiento de datos.

Makedonski Telekom and T-Mobile Macedonia as of 1 July 2015 officially became one company. The Resolution was adopted on the Shareholders’ Assembly held on 17 June 2015 by accepting the Accession Agreement. As of 1 July 2015, T-Mobile Macedonia ceased to exist as a legal entity, whereas all employees, and the total assets and liabilities were taken over by Makedonski Telekom.  Both of them are part od Deutche Telecom. 

Cable operator Blizoo bought 9 smaller cable operators in 2015.

Two mobile operators - One and Vip merged together in 2015. Makedonski Telekom and T-Mobile Macedonia as of 1 July 2015 officially became one company. The Resolution was adopted on the Shareholders’ Assembly held on 17 June 2015 by accepting the Accession Agreement. As of 1 July 2015, T-Mobile Macedonia ceased to exist as a legal entity, whereas all employees, and the total assets and liabilities were taken over by Makedonski Telekom. Both of them are part od Deutche Telecom. 
Cable operator Blizoo bought 9 smaller cable operators in 2015.
